title.value: Consciousness in Artificial Intelligence: Insights from the Science of Consciousness
title.justification: This is the title of the research paper.
title.quote: Consciousness in Artificial Intelligence: Insights from the Science of Consciousness

extractions.description: This report discusses the possibility of consciousness in artificial intelligence, drawing on prominent scientific theories of consciousness, such as recurrent processing theory, global workspace theory, and higher-order theories. The report provides a framework for evaluating AI systems for consciousness based on "indicator properties" derived from these theories and assesses several recent AI systems, including large language models and embodied agents.

type.justification: The report draws on theoretical and empirical evidence from neuroscience and applies it to AI.
type.quote: This report argues for, and exemplifies, a rigorous and empirically grounded approach to AI consciousness: assessing existing AI systems in detail, in light of our best-supported neuroscientific theories of consciousness.

name.justification: The report focuses on assessing consciousness in artificial intelligence.
name.quote: Whether current or near-term AI systems could be conscious is a topic of scientific interest and increasing public concern.

name.justification: The report specifically assesses the possibility of consciousness in artificial intelligence.
name.quote: This report is about what we take to be the best scientific evidence for and against consciousness in current and near-term AI systems.

name.justification: The report heavily relies on neuroscientific theories of consciousness.
name.quote: We describe prominent theories of this kind and investigate their implications for AI.

name.justification: The report assesses various AI models and systems.
name.quote: We use these indicator properties to assess several recent AI systems, and we discuss how future systems might implement them.

is_contributed.justification: The report focuses on assessing existing AI systems, not contributing new ones.
is_contributed.quote: We use these indicator properties to assess several recent AI systems, and we discuss how future systems might implement them.

is_executed.justification: The report mentions several AI systems and how they perform on various tasks, indicating their execution.
is_executed.quote: These systems include Transformer-based large language models and the Perceiver architecture, which we analyse with respect to the global workspace theory. We also analyse DeepMind’s Adaptive Agent, which is a reinforcement learning agent operating in a 3D virtual environment; a system trained to perform tasks by controlling a virtual rodent body; and PaLM-E, which has been described as an “embodied multimodal language model”.
